intro: Adicea succulenta, commonly known as the succulent daisy, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its rosette-forming leaves that are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Its flowers typically bloom in shades of yellow and white, often appearing in spring and summer. Adicea succulenta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
